meanings.sent1: Please deactivate the alarm before entering the building.
meanings.sent2: They had to deactivate the old security system before installing the new one.
meanings.sent3: Trying to deactivate a chirping smoke detector can be quite a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her soothing voice seemed to deactivate his stress instantly.
meanings.sent5: The magician waved his wand to deactivate the spell cast on the princess.

meanings.definition: To render something ineffective or nonfunctional.
meanings.sent1: The hacker attempted to deactivate the firewall to gain access to the system.
meanings.sent2: The virus was designed to deactivate the computer's antivirus software.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's mission was to deactivate the doomsday device before it caused chaos.
meanings.sent4: His words had the power to deactivate her anger and bring a smile to her face.
meanings.sent5: The key to success is to deactivate any doubts that may hold you back.
